intro: Sanguisorba minor var. delortii, commonly known as the lesser teasel, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its upright stems and clusters of small, reddish-brown flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and the plant often forms dense clumps in moist, well-drained soils. It is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and provide habitat for various insects.
